title: Reactivation of expired commercial driver's license; fees; road test waived
context: ยง286-239.5 Reactivation of expired commercial driver&rsquo;s license; fees; road test waived. (a) Unless revoked or suspended, and except as provided in subsection (b), any commercial driver&rsquo;s license that has expired under section 286-239 or rules adopted pursuant to section 286-246 may be reactivated by the licensee in accordance with the requirements and procedures set forth for the renewal of commercial drivers&rsquo; licenses under section 286-239(g). No person seeking reactivation of an expired commercial driver&rsquo;s license under this subsection shall be required to undergo reexamination of the person&rsquo;s driving skills under section 286-236. The examiner of drivers shall require the holder of an expired commercial driver&rsquo;s license to pay a reactivation fee of $5 for each thirty-day period, or fraction thereof, that has elapsed after a ninety-day grace period. (b) Any commercial driver&rsquo;s license not reactivated under subsection (a) within one year of the indicated date of expiration shall be invalid. The examiner of drivers shall examine an applicant whose commercial driver&rsquo;s license has been declared invalid under this subsection in accordance with the licensing procedures established under sections 286-236 and 286-239.
